titles: Edinburgh, 6 April 1653. Forasmeikle as the provest, bailies, and councel of this burgh being conveened in counsel, finding that this good town hath been, and is greatly abused by strangers, vagabonds, unfree persons, and masterlesse people ...
author: Edinburgh (Scotland). Town Council.
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
keywords: Rogues and vagabonds --  Legal status, laws, etc. --  Scotland --  Edinburgh --  Early works to 1800.
